text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A government plan to reform the civil service and deal with the bloated bureacracy by setting up committees to evaluate performance of civil servants and retrain and rehabilitate underperformers.

- Jordan ranked fourth in league of contributors to the U.N. peacekeeping forces in April; the kingdom's troops play a major role in police monitoring and peacekeeping duties in eight different troublespots around the globe.

- Deputy Prime Minister Ensour says King Hussein is determined to tackle nations concerns; says a "social safety net" plan to alleviate poverty is a ten-year strategy requiring $1 billion and which still needs to be presented to donors to get support.

- Finance and planning ministers head to Abu Dhabi to attend annual meetings of Arab finanancial institutions; finance minister says meetings an opportunity for bilateral and joint consultation to help boost Arab economies.
